Just saying

No pressure

blog.name: bonesgadh
blog.title: Another Arya Stark Stan
blog.description: Just a girl who is obsessed with many things: Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Bones, Pitch Perfect, La La Land, Desperate Housewives, Stranger Things, Friends, HIMYM, Orange Is The New Black, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, The Hunger Games. Cheese addict. Dog lover. Disney and Pixar crazy fan. Pretty decent cook. 🇲🇽. Proud Gryffindor. Broadway Freak. Drummer. I write stuff, mostly fanfiction. Rey Solo theorist. I love all sports. Main ships: Booth & Brennan, Gendrya, Ross & Rachel, Jeca, Everlark, Merder, Mileven, Damerey, Harmione. I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with Julie Andrews and I love John Williams beyond all things. Current state: waiting for Stranger Things 3.

summary: Tag yourself: Game of Thrones characters as members of a school project edition.
body:
Tag yourself: Game of Thrones characters as members of a school project edition.

Arya: you show up in the end when it seems everything is lost and no one has any idea of what to do, and you fix everything in ten seconds. Everyone congratulates you but you refuse to take the credit.

Daenerys: you contribute a great deal to the project but because your teammates hate you they choose to ignore what you did and tell the teacher you did nothing. Somehow you end up failing the class.

Tyrion: you pride yourself in being the smartest of the group but your team gets stucked with a topic you know nothing about and you are forced to remain quiet and watch from the sidelines.

Jon: a straight As student, you pressure your teammates to get the work done to the point you annoy them. You call them, text them and chase them around until they listen to you.

Sansa: you are a bit useless but you give moral support. You contribute with the bare minimal but somehow the teacher awards you with an extra point at the end of the presentation.

The Hound: you hate team work and spend the entire time complaining about how stupid your teammates are. Still you do your thing because you don’t want to fail.

Bran: you are in risk of failing the class so the team makes it their mission to save you. There’s a chance everyone will fail because of you but you do nothing to stop them or to save yourself.

Cersei: you pay someone else to do your part of the work while you fool around with your current boyfriend or girlfriend. You are a little shit and don’t care about your teammates, you only care about your own grade.

Theon: you feel guilty because you convinced your friend to skip a lot of classes and now they need an A+ to pass. You try to make it up to them even if that means failing yourself.

Beric: when one of your classmates freezes and forgets what they were supposed to say during the presentation you step forward and save them. Not all heros wear capes.

Tormund: you crack inappropiate jokes mid-work and distract everyone, also you smuggle alcohol into the team gatherings. No one things you will pass but during the presentation you are one of the best.

Gendry: when they asked you to be part of the team you had no idea what you were getting yourself into but you accepted anyway. You are a good element and get rewarded for your help.

Brienne: you had a plan of what the team was supposed to do but you end up feeling overwhelmed because you underestimated how much work you had to do. Still you get an A for effort.

Jaime: the good-hearted jock. You chose to split from your bestie because you want a good grade to get into a nice college. However, after you pass you go back to your old ways.

Podrick: you didn’t know shit about your team’s topic but somehow learned everything five minutes before the presentation. Everyone likes you because you are hard working.

Jorah: you are loyal to your friends and if you fail at least you will fail together. It sucks because you are a good student and you almost passed but you got distracted for a second.

Lyanna: you are a new student and you don’t know as much as your teammates but you do something amazing at the presentation and impress the teacher.

Melisandre: you spend most team gatherings talking shit and getting everyone into trouble but you had one brilliant idea that is crutial to the team’s success. You are a good motivator and you change schools a lot.

Ghost: you are a very important part of the team but for some reason no one seems to notice it and they never congratulate you. However you still get the work done and never fail.

The Night King: overconfident, you brag about being the teacher’s favorite and you don’t prepare for the presentation. They kick you out of the team because you suck.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
Show
          Chapter
        |
        Archive of Our Own
body:
the next chapter of say we’re only dreaming should be out sometime this weekend! i’m nearly done writing it and the final edits won’t take too long as i’ve been doing a lot of it as i go along. sorry for the slight wait, it’s been over a week since the last once, but i promise it’ll be worth it. this chapter is currently clocking in at over twice the length of the last one and you’ll see quite a few new POV’s and some interesting hints to many of the subplots to this story! in the meantime those of you who haven’t should definitely check out the beginning of this gendrya aladdin!au (which is becoming more like a got/aladdin mashup)

Show Chapter | Archive of Our Own

blog.name: buttercuparry
blog.title: Warm Winter Sun
blog.description: If a 12 year old has to save the world then so be it!

body:
Arya and Goddess Aarya

So recently I came across a post about how Dany’s name bears a similarity to the mythical goddesses of various cultures and it got me thinking about Arya. Suffice to say that I did some digging of my own and what I found was indeed a pleasant surprise.

We know that Grrm took inspiration for Arya’s name from Sanskrit and as a language that was once spoken in ancient India, it’s not surprising that it would be connected to the religion of Hinduism (in this context with the names of the Gods and Goddesses of the religion). So while I was looking into it, I came across a post about the hindu goddess Durga. Now in my culture this Goddess is believed to be the supreme Mother who in turn is the manifestation of Shakti (the power which drives the universe). She is also said to have a total of 108 names or avatars and yes, one of her names is Aarya. Aarya is that avatar of the Goddess who takes the form of the warrior. She is also worshipped as the goddess of harvest and as the protectress of women.

In my opinion Arya of asoiaf symbolizes various aspects of the Hindu Goddess. Granted that I have a pet peeve against calling Arya a warrior but it is so much more than that. In Hinduism, when we worship the Goddess in her “warrior form”, we are actually celebrating the triumph of good over evil: Arya believes that justice should be brought to all the evils in the world and often takes up the role of punishing those who have harmed the innocents

Arya drew back from him. “He killed the slave?” That did not sound right. “He should have killed the masters!”

Raff the Sweetling looked up sharply as the long thin blade came sliding from her sleeve. She slipped it through his throat beneath the chin, twisted, and ripped it back out sideways with a single smooth slash. A fine red rain followed, and in his eyes the light went out

Harvesting is the symbol of abundance and hence in turn of fertility. Arya’s storyline is teemed with symbols of fertility: baby pearls, acorns, the moon, forests and water. And as for being the protectress of women I can’t help but go back to her looking after Weasel in a war torn region and her avenging the rape of the innkeeper’s daughter. Also her iconic line:

The woman is important too!

Besides these, there are some other peculiar similarities that Arya shares with the goddess. Durga ( Aarya) is the wife of Shiva, the god of destruction/death and hence of rejuvination in nature and a new beginning. Again I am not saying that Arya Stark is married to death but it is one of the prevalent themes in her storyline. Also as of now she is an acolyte of the HoBaW, a cult which serves the Many Faced God and believes in the balance of the natural order: Valar morghulis or All men must die.

Durga is also considered to be the daughter of Himavan, the king of Himalayas. A princess of the mountains. Guess which character in asoiaf was named after Arya Flint of the mountain clans? That’s right A(a)rya Stark!!

Listen I know that I am reading too much into this thing; but as both a Hindu and an Arya stan, I couldn’t just not point out the similarities between this little girl and the great goddess of the myth.

Also as of now she is an acolyte of the HoBaW, a cult which serves the Many Faced God and believes in the balance of the natural order: Valar morghulis or All men must die.

Durga is also considered to be the daughter of Himavan, the king of Himalayas. A princess of the mountains. Guess which character in asoiaf was named after Arya Flint of the mountain clans? That’s right A(a)rya Stark!!

Listen I know that I am reading too much into this thing; but as both a Hindu and an Arya stan, I couldn’t just not point out the similarities between this little girl and the great goddess of the myth.
trail.content:
Arya and Goddess Aarya

So recently I came across a post about how Dany’s name bears a similarity to the mythical goddesses of various cultures and it got me thinking about Arya. Suffice to say that I did some digging of my own and what I found was indeed a pleasant surprise.

We know that Grrm took inspiration for Arya’s name from Sanskrit and as a language that was once spoken in ancient India, it’s not surprising that it would be connected to the religion of Hinduism (in this context with the names of the Gods and Goddesses of the religion). So while I was looking into it, I came across a post about the hindu goddess Durga. Now in my culture this Goddess is believed to be the supreme Mother who in turn is the manifestation of Shakti (the power which drives the universe). She is also said to have a total of 108 names or avatars and yes, one of her names is Aarya. Aarya is that avatar of the Goddess who takes the form of the warrior. She is also worshipped as the goddess of harvest and as the protectress of women.

In my opinion Arya of asoiaf symbolizes various aspects of the Hindu Goddess. Granted that I have a pet peeve against calling Arya a warrior but it is so much more than that. In Hinduism, when we worship the Goddess in her “warrior form”, we are actually celebrating the triumph of good over evil: Arya believes that justice should be brought to all the evils in the world and often takes up the role of punishing those who have harmed the innocents

Arya drew back from him. “He killed the slave?” That did not sound right. “He should have killed the masters!”

Raff the Sweetling looked up sharply as the long thin blade came sliding from her sleeve. She slipped it through his throat beneath the chin, twisted, and ripped it back out sideways with a single smooth slash. A fine red rain followed, and in his eyes the light went out

Harvesting is the symbol of abundance and hence in turn of fertility. Arya’s storyline is teemed with symbols of fertility: baby pearls, acorns, the moon, forests and water. And as for being the protectress of women I can’t help but go back to her looking after Weasel in a war torn region and her avenging the rape of the innkeeper’s daughter. Also her iconic line:

The woman is important too!

Besides these, there are some other peculiar similarities that Arya shares with the goddess. Durga ( Aarya) is the wife of Shiva, the god of destruction/death and hence of rejuvination in nature and a new beginning. Again I am not saying that Arya Stark is married to death but it is one of the prevalent themes in her storyline. Also as of now she is an acolyte of the HoBaW, a cult which serves the Many Faced God and believes in the balance of the natural order: Valar morghulis or All men must die.

Durga is also considered to be the daughter of Himavan, the king of Himalayas. A princess of the mountains. Guess which character in asoiaf was named after Arya Flint of the mountain clans? That’s right A(a)rya Stark!!

Listen I know that I am reading too much into this thing; but as both a Hindu and an Arya stan, I couldn’t just not point out the similarities between this little girl and the great goddess of the myth.

blog.title: Catelyn Stark was mean to the godswood

summary: "Is there gold hidden in the village?" she shouted as she drove the blade up through [the Tickler’s] back. "Is there silver?...
body:
“Is there gold hidden in the village?” she shouted as she drove the blade up through [the Tickler’s] back. “Is there silver? Gems?” She stabbed twice more. “Is there food? Where is Lord Beric?” She was on top of him by then, still stabbing. “Where did he go? How many men were with him? How many knights? How many bowmen? How many, how many, how many, how many, how many, how many? Is there gold in the village?" 
Her hands were red and sticky when Sandor dragged her off him. (A Storm of Swords - Arya XIII)

She knocked aside his arm and punched the steel into his bowels. "Laugh,” she snarled at him. He moaned instead. “Laugh,” she repeated, grabbing his throat with one hand and stabbing at his belly with the other. “Laugh!” She kept saying it, over and over, until her hand was red up to the wrist and the stink of the fool’s dying was like to choke her. But Shagwell never laughed. The sobs that Brienne heard were all her own. When she realized that, she threw down her knife and shuddered. (A Feast for Crows - Brienne IV)

Arya receives new weapons. Two ships leave King’s Landing for Dorne. The sea brings unwanted dreams. Tyrion looks forward Dornish wine.

tags: I headcanon that Arya and Dany are best friends
summary: Arya: when 2020 rolls around catch me calling all my best friends ‘old sport’. My inner Jay Gatsby is about to pop off. May fuck...
body:
Arya: when 2020 rolls around catch me calling all my best friends ‘old sport’. My inner Jay Gatsby is about to pop off. May fuck around and throw parties for an unrequited love. Might die in a pool. Who knows?

Gendry: *sitting next to Arya with his arm wrapped around her* what was that second to last one?

Arya: Might die in a pool?

Gendry: The one before that

Arya: throw parties for an unrequited love?

Gendry: *looking pointedly at the wedding ring on her hand* yeah that one

Dany: *on Arya’s other side* can we focus on the pool bit?

Gendry: yeah, not a fan of that either

Arya: just for that neither of you are getting an ‘old sport’
